Sivertson claimed that production "never lost any shooting days because of rehab," with Lohan declaring she drew from what she was personally experiencing to tackle some of the film's darker themes.
Sivertson mentioned that the influence for directing the film was filtered through Hitchcock.
Sivertson described the stylistic influence as Hitchcock filtered through De Palma and Lynch.
Sivertson mentioned that there were echoes of some of his favorite movies in the script, including stuff like Vertigo, Dressed to Kill, Twin Peaks, and Blue Velvet.
Sivertson wanted the movie to play both as a dark psychological thriller and as a surreal fairy tale.
